snippet: In an effort to prop up prices, officials have signaled a willingness to endure reduced profits rather than cut production, as they did to their later regret in the early 1980s.
abstract: Saudi Arabia, as global oil prices plunge at pace not seen since 2008 financial crisis, is being accused by some of deliberately depressing the market to weaken rivals like Iran; for their part, Saudi officials signal willingness to endure reduced profits rather than cut production in an effort to prop up prices.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Beirut, and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: In an effort to prop up prices, officials have signaled a willingness to endure reduced profits rather than cut production, as they did to their later regret in the early 1980s.

headline.main: As Oil Prices Plummet, Saudi Arabia Faces a Test of Strategy
headline.print_headline: As Oil Prices Plummet, Saudi Arabia Faces a Test of Strategy

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
